content: aisling a shawlette by michaela jandacek supplies yarn 225 yards dk 210 yards worsted needles us8 dk us10 worsted for other weights use needles about two sizes larger than recommended stitch markers 2 abbreviations st stitch k knit p purl yo yarn over pm place marker sm slip marker m1r make 1 right m1l make 1 left s1 k2 psso slip 1 stitch knitwise knit 2 stitches pass slipped stitch over two knitted stitches garter tab cast on 3 stitches and knit 6 row pick up 3 stitches along facing edge and 3 along cast-on 9 sts row 1 rs k2 yo k2 pm k1 pm k2 yo k2 11 sts row 2 ws k2 yo k3 m1r sm k1 sm m1l k3 yo k2 15 sts garter pattern row 3 rs k2 yo knit to marker m1r sm k1 sm m1l knit to last 2 stitches yo k2 row 4 ws k2 yo knit to last 2 sts yo k2 repeat row 3 and 4 until you have a total of 129 sts or desired size modified irish mesh r1 rs k2 yo s1 k2 psso to marker yo m1r sm k1 m1l yo s1 k2 psso to last 2 sts yo k2 r2 ws k2 yo p to last 2 sts yo k2 repeat these two row 7-9 more times or to desired length repeat row 1 once more tip if your stitch count on either side of the marker is not divisible by 3 on the first row of mesh process your last 3- stitch repeat as follows one stitch too many yo s1 k2tog k1 psso two stitches too many yo s1 k2tog k2tog psso finishing knit 3 row ending with a wrong-side row bind off loosely in knit or recommended by using jeny s surprisingly stretchy bind off weave in ends soak shawl for ten minutes block and enjoy © michaela jandacek 2013 pattern intended for personal use
